channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11862] Get rid of Writables in HTableDescriptor, HColumnDescriptor
item.description: Currently we have protobuf for encoding this structures. Existence of Writable is misleading and need to be removed.
item.summary: Get rid of Writables in HTableDescriptor, HColumnDescriptor

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: this patch is needed for HBASE-7767. need to implement hidden part of HTableDescriptor, and Writables are complicates that.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12666948/HBASE-11862.patch
against trunk revision .

This message is automatically generated.
Nice patch. Why ImmutableBytes? Can we not use Bytes class?

stack Bytes (I presume, that we are talking about org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/Bytes.java) has no constructor (its actually a helper class for static methods) and has no needed semantics (comparable for sets/hashsets, immutability and zero copy). So I decided to copy/paste ImmutableBytesWritablte. Or you suggesting to enhance Bytes with needed semantics?
Updated patch. ImmutableBytes was removed. Now Bytes class can be used to wrap byte[] arrays.
